slides.title: <mark>5 Non-Negotiable Sunday Activities</mark> to Make Sure You Win The Week:
slides.author: Written by Colby Kultgen

slides.body:
A successful week starts on <mark>Sunday night.</mark>

Wait until Monday to get organized, and you'll spend the week playing catch-up.

Here are <mark>5 things</mark> to do every Sunday to win the week ahead:

slides.title: <mark>Do a self-review</mark>
slides.body:
Have a quick solo meeting with yourself.

Take 10 minutes to review:
• What went well?
• What didn't?
• What's one thing to improve?

These small course corrections make a massive difference in the long run.

slides.title: <mark>Do a quick reset of your space</mark>
slides.body:
A messy space = a messy mind.

Take 20 minutes to tidy up your home, clean your workspace, and put things back where they belong.

A clear space makes Monday feel less chaotic.

slides.title: <mark>Do something for future you</mark>
slides.body:
Make Monday easier.

Prep meals.
Lay out your gym clothes.
Write your top 3 priorities for next week.

Small actions on Sunday can save you from big headaches on Monday.

slides.title: <mark>Close open loops</mark>
slides.body:
That lingering email.
That half-finished task.
That text you forgot to reply to.

Open loops drain mental energy.

Take 30 minutes to tie up loose ends so you're not carrying them into Monday.

slides.title: <mark>Do something offline</mark>
slides.body:
It's hard to recover if you're always plugged in.

Go for a walk.
Read a book.
Spend time with a friend.

Giving your brain a break today means showing up sharper for the week ahead.
